edu.ucla.sspace.matrix
Interface GlobalTransform

All Known Implementing Classes:
CorrelationTransform.CorrelationGlobalTransform, LogEntropyTransform.LogEntropyGlobalTransform, LogLikelihoodTransform.LogLikelihoodGlobalTransform, PointWiseMutualInformationTransform.PointWiseMutualInformationGlobalTransform, RowMagnitudeTransform.RowMagnitudeGlobalTransform, TfIdfDocStripedTransform.TfIdfGlobalTransform, TfIdfTransform.TfIdfGlobalTransform
public interface GlobalTransform

An interface for matrix transformations. Transformations that can be done with either no knowledge of the given matrix or with only global knowledge, such as row and column summations, can be implemented with this transformation. This is a supplement to the more general Transform interface to fascilitate. By implementing this interface, a transformation can be done on any file type and any matrix type with little extra work.

Implementations are expected to gather any required statistics through their constructor. Afterwards, users of the transform may request each entry in a matrix to be transformed based on it's row, column, and value. Each entry is welcome to interpret the meaning of row, column, and value differently. It is recomended that implementations be made a subclass of a Transform implementation. A good example is the TfIdfTransform.

Note that most instances of a GlobalTransform should be used with only one matrix. Training on one matrix and applying the transformation to another will often result in an unintelligible transformation. Transformations that do not need to compute any statistics can be applied to any matrix without any complications, such as a transformation that adds 5 to every entry.

Author:
Keith Stevens

Method Summary
 double transform(int row, int column, double value)
          Returns the transformed value for a given matrix entry.
 

Method Detail

transform

double transform(int row,
                 int column,
                 double value)
Returns the transformed value for a given matrix entry.

Parameters:
row - The row of the entry to be transformed
column - The column of the entry to be transformed
value - The old value of the entry to be transformed
Returns:
The new value of the entry located at row, column
